text: This PR add an error message if a string instead of a list of string is given in the localizer fetching function (I think that it may be a common mistake and the previous error message was cryptic). I also removed the variables for the URL when using default verbose option (verbose=0). The full URL is still displayed if verbose > 0 (fix #316).
title: Better error message for localizer, simpler error message.

title: Pull request merge from AlexandreAbraham/nilearn:brainomics to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: Just as a reminder to ourselves, in we ever forget about this, the verbose parameter need to be passed into _fetch_file.

urllib.splitquery may be a bit clearer. It returns a tuple `url_without_query, query`

Also slight niggle, I would do 

``` python

displayed_url = urllib.splitquery(url)[0] if verbose == 0 else url
print 'Dowloading data from %s ...' % displayed_url
```
